alert.note: Alert for Hutchinson; Moore; Oldham; Sherman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 19 at 2:14AM CDT until April 20 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FOR PARTS OF THE WESTERN tEXAS AND OKLAHOMA PANHANDLES AND ALSO PARTS OF THE CENTRAL TEXAS PANHANDLE... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Fire Weather Watch for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * Affected Area...In Texas...Sherman...Moore...Hutchinson and Oldham. * 20 Foot Winds...East to southeast 10 to 20 mph becoming west to southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph following the passage of a warm front. * Relative Humidity...As low as 7 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...2 to 4. * Timing...Critical fire weather conditions beginning around 11 AM CDT and ending around 9 PM CDT.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
